column4: my fresh install is buggered, what is a stable version of ubuntu?
kira: thanks, but it wont boot up - what about b4 8.10?
this question can be easily answered by visiting the website...
thanks.  but I've cheched websittes, forums, and here, and i cant seem to get an answer...
how about the get ubuntu page?
remove quiet from the grub boot options
isnt that for PC's w/low RAM?
and debugging
thankyou.  i'v now got the main screen u get when one logs in, but now i have a "failed to initialze HAL" error
anything more specific than that?
nope, just the home screen with a box with that error, and a frozen mouse. aly-f2 takes me to a terminal looking page asking for login details
i can log in. is there a cmd i can run to diagnose/fix
are you looking at a tty or gnome?
tty2
did you boot as rescue mode?
if not, "sudo dmesg | tail" may help
no, & ok
what in the output is of help, the only stand out seems to be "No VRS found"
might want to look back more than 10 lines, then
it actually only gives me exactly 10 lines
right. there's a tail option to get more
i think it's -n, though i'm not sure
